page.title: 03Hamlets around Cattistock
page.content: The small village of Wraxall, consisting of 16 houses, is separated into two parts, with church and Jacobean Manor House in separate valleys. The remaining dwellings all date from before the last century The hamlet of Chalmington, with 13 houses, contains a manor house with small ornamental park and lodge. The former stables of the manor have been converted into two dwelling houses. Three modern dwellings have been erected, the remainder of the houses being of much earlier date. Two former mills in isolated positions on the banks of the River Frome have now been converted into dwelling houses. The hamlet of Sandhills consists of eight houses, one a former public house.
